newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Tysan raises stake in Tianjin project.
newsitem.headline: Tysan raises stake in Tianjin project.

text.p: Hong Kong construction firm Tysan Holdings Ltd said in a statement on Wednesday it became the controlling shareholder of Tianjin International Building by investing HK$103 million to raise its stake in the development.
But the company gave no numerical details about the change in its shareholding in the commerical and residential complex in Tianjin in northeastern China.
The building, currently generating a gross annual rental income of about US$15 million, gave Tysan a profit contribution of HK$16 million in the year to March 31, 1996, it said.

The acquisition will be financed in full by the net proceeds of HK$106 million to be received from the recent disposal of a Hong Kong investment property at King's Road, Quarry Bay, the statement said.
Tysan is engaged in foundation works, hiring and trading of construction machinery, and property investment and development.
